ðŸš€ livecc | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling AI systems to generate real-time commentary for videos by processing video content and its associated audio stream simultaneously.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time video commentary generation â€¢ Streaming speech transcription for video LLMs â€¢ State-of-the-art performance on streaming and offline benchmarks â€¢ Pre-training and instruction tuning capabilities â€¢ Large-scale dataset (Live-WhisperX-526K) and benchmark (LiveSports-3K) available
ðŸ“– Summary: LiveCC is a video Large Language Model (LLM) designed for real-time commentary generation. It utilizes a novel streaming speech transcription method to process video and generate commentary, achieving state-of-the-art performance on both streaming and offline benchmarks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ xleak | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Viewing and interacting with Excel spreadsheets directly in the terminal without needing Microsoft Excel.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Beautiful terminal rendering â€¢ Interactive TUI mode â€¢ Smart data type handling â€¢ Multi-sheet support â€¢ Excel Table support
ðŸ“– Summary: xleak is a fast terminal-based Excel viewer built with Rust and ratatui. It provides an interactive TUI for navigating and searching spreadsheet data, supporting various Excel and OpenDocument formats with features like lazy loading for large files and export capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ filesql | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Querying and manipulating data within various file formats (CSV, TSV, Parquet, Excel) using SQL syntax directly within Go applications, without requiring a traditional database setup.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ SQLite3 SQL Interface â€¢ Support for CSV, TSV, LTSV, Parquet, and Excel (XLSX) files â€¢ Automatic handling of .gz, .bz2, .xz, .zst, .z, .snappy, .s2, and .lz4 compressed files â€¢ Stream processing for large files â€¢ Support for file paths, directories, io.Reader, and embed.FS
ðŸ“– Summary: filesql is a Go SQL driver that allows users to query various file formats like CSV, TSV, LTSV, Parquet, and Excel using standard SQLite3 SQL syntax. It supports multiple compression formats and flexible input sources, enabling in-memory data processing without external databases.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
